title: A Randomized, Open-Label, Multiple Dose Clinical Pharmacology Study of Two Doses of a Selective p38 MAP Kinase Inhibitor, VX-745 in Patients With Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI) Due to Alzheimer's Disease (AD) or With Mild AD
description_brief: This study will assess the effects of VX-745 on markers of disease in the central nervous system of patients with MCI due to AD or with mild AD. The study will also evaluate the safety and tolerability of VX-745 in these patients during 6 weeks of dosing, as well as the plasma and cerebrospinal fluid concentrations of VX-745 during dosing.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: During the course of the study, and after one subject had been enrolled in the 125 mg dose group, FDA mandated the removal of the 125 mg dose group. As a result, the number subjects was revised downward to 9, 8 as planned in the 40 mg dose group and 1 in the 125 mg dose group.

groups.title: Neflamapimod (VX-745) Dose Level 1
groups.description:
Active Group 1: VX-745 40 mg twice daily

Neflamapimod (VX-745): Orally-active P38 MAP kinase alpha-selective inhibitor

groups.title: Neflamapimod (VX-745) Dose Level 2
groups.description:
Active Group 1: VX-745 125 mg twice daily

Neflamapimod (VX-745): Orally-active P38 MAP kinase alpha-selective inhibitor

Active Group 1: VX-745 dose level 1 twice daily

VX-745: Orally-active P38 MAP kinase alpha-selective inhibitor

groups.title: VX-745 Dose Level 2
groups.description:
Active Group 1: VX-745 dose level 2 twice daily

VX-745: Orally-active P38 MAP kinase alpha-selective inhibitor

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change From Baseline to End of Treatment in Cerebrospinal Fluid Levels of Cytokines
outcomeMeasures.description: Cytokines: Of nine cytokines assessed, only CSF IL-8 quantifiable at all time points. And so, only IL-8 levels are being reported herein. The analysis was exploratory and no statistical analysis was performed.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: As there was only one subject in the 125 mg dose group (see Pre-Assignment Details), and the blood concentration levels in this subject was similar to that in 125 mg dose group, this subjects data was combined with the 40 mg dose group in this analysis. In addition, two subjects did not have Day 42 CSF samples available for analysis
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline and Day 42 of dosing with VX-745

groups.title: Overall Study Population
groups.description: Combined 40 mg and 125 mg subjects; N=7 with baseline and Day 42 results

outcomeMeasures.title: Severe or Serious Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of patients with severe or serious adverse events
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: At baseline and at each study visit during (days 1, 7, 14, 21, 28, 35 and 42) and after (day 51) dosing

groups.title: Neflamapimod (VX-745) Dose Level 1
groups.description:
Active Group 1: VX-745 40 mg twice daily

Neflamapimod (VX-745): Orally-active P38 MAP kinase alpha-selective inhibitor

groups.title: Neflamapimod (VX-745) Dose Level 2
groups.description:
Active Group 1: VX-745 125 mg twice daily

Neflamapimod (VX-745): Orally-active P38 MAP kinase alpha-selective inhibitor

outcomeMeasures.title: Maximal CSF VX-745 Concentration
outcomeMeasures.description: Ratio fo CSF to plasma drug concentration at time matched time points. Samples taken
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: As there was only one subject in the 125 mg dose group (see Pre-Assignment Details), and the blood concentration levels in this subject was similar to that in 125 mg dose group, this subjects data was combined with the 40 mg dose group in this analysis.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: All samples with quantifiable CSF drug levels were included (n=12). Eight were obtained 3-hours post-dose, either on Day 1 (n=4) or Day 42 (n=4). 3 samples were at 6-hours post-dose on Day 42; and one was at 6-hours post-dose on Day 1.

outcomeMeasures.title: Episodic Memory Function
outcomeMeasures.description: Total Recall in Hopkins Verbal Learning Test (HVLT). Range is 0-36, with increases in score indicating improvement in cognitive function.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: As there was only one subject in the 125 mg dose group (see Pre-Assignment Details), and the blood concentration levels in this subject was similar to that in 125 mg dose group, this subjects data was combined with the 40 mg dose group in all outcome measure analyses. In addition, one subject did not have a Day 42 HVLT-R analysis.

eventGroups.title: Overall Study Population
eventGroups.description: Combined 40 mg and 125 mg subjects. As there was only one subject in the 125 mg dose group (see Pre-Assignment Details), and the blood concentration levels in this subject was similar to that in 125 mg dose group, this subjects data was combined with the 40 mg dose group in the adverse event analysis.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Clinical study was conducted at at clinical pharmacology unit owned by a contract research organization (CRO; Parexel) that was contracted by the sponsor to conduct the study. Site principal investigator is an employee of a contract research organization. As per the contract, the sponsor has "all rights, title and interest in the results".

explanation_target: Reason: The investigational product VX-745 is a selective small-molecule inhibitor of the p38α mitogen-activated protein kinase (p38 MAPK) and is being developed to target molecular/pathophysiologic mechanisms (synaptic dysfunction/neuroinflammation) in early Alzheimer's disease rather than as a symptomatic cognitive enhancer or a neuropsychiatric treatment. citeturn0search5turn0search1

Act: Key extracted details — drug name and type: VX-745, also known as neflamapimod, is an oral small-molecule, ATP-competitive p38α MAPK inhibitor. Development and clinical testing have been performed for CNS indications including MCI/mild AD. citeturn0search6turn0search5

Act (trial-specific): The described study is an open-label, multiple-dose clinical pharmacology study assessing VX-745 effects on CNS disease markers, safety/tolerability and plasma/CSF drug levels over 6 weeks in patients with MCI due to AD or mild AD — consistent with a disease-targeting pharmacologic approach. citeturn0search4turn0search2

Reflect: Classification check — because VX-745/neflamapimod is a small-molecule kinase inhibitor aimed at modulating AD-related biology (p38α signaling and downstream neuroinflammatory/synaptic processes), it fits the definition of a "disease-targeted small molecule" rather than a biologic, purely symptomatic cognitive enhancer, or a neuropsychiatric symptomatic treatment. No placebo is indicated in the provided open-label design. citeturn0search5turn0search4
explanation_agent: Reason: VX-745 (neflamapimod) is a selective small‑molecule inhibitor of p38α MAP kinase (MAPK14). p38α is a central signaling kinase that drives production of pro‑inflammatory mediators (e.g., IL‑1β, TNFα) and is implicated in neuroinflammation that contributes to AD pathophysiology; the program is explicitly described as modulating neuroinflammatory/synaptic processes in early AD. citeturn0search3turn0search4turn0search1

Act: Extracted experimental details — drug: VX‑745 (neflamapimod), mechanism: ATP‑competitive/ selective p38α MAPK inhibitor; clinical context: tested in MCI/mild AD to target disease biology (reduce neuroinflammation and restore synaptic function) rather than only symptomatic treatment. The specific study described is an open‑label, multiple‑dose pharmacology study assessing CNS markers, safety, and PK/CSF levels. citeturn0search5turn0search4turn0search2

Reflect: Mapping to CADRO — p38α inhibition primarily intervenes in inflammatory signaling in the brain (neuroinflammation) and thereby secondarily affects synaptic function. The most specific CADRO category that matches the drug's direct biological target and stated mechanism is F) Inflammation. Note: because the drug is a single molecular kinase inhibitor (not a broad multi‑target agent), and its principal mechanistic rationale is modulation of inflammatory signaling (even though synaptic plasticity is an important downstream goal), F) Inflammation is the most appropriate classification rather than M) Synaptic Plasticity/Neuroprotection or R) Multi‑target. citeturn0search4turn0search6

- Neflamapimod (VX‑745) described as a brain‑penetrant, selective p38α (MAPK14) inhibitor being developed for early AD; clinical review noting its development to reverse synaptic dysfunction via p38α inhibition. citeturn0search4

- NCATS / drug database entry summarizing neflamapimod as a brain‑penetrant p38α inhibitor in Phase 2 for early AD and describing suppression of inflammatory mediators (IL‑1β, TNFα). citeturn0search3
- Trial registry/clinical listings and trial descriptions for VX‑745 / neflamapimod in MCI/mild AD (phase 2 studies; pharmacology and PoC trials). citeturn0search2turn0search5

- Preclinical/experimental reports showing that neflamapimod inhibits p38α phosphorylation and downstream targets (e.g., Hsp27), reduces inflammatory signaling and produces physiologic effects relevant to AD models. citeturn0search1turn0search6
